item.title: Norway
item.description:
50 miles per hour
My guideline for the day.
Enjoy the flow.
Large panorama open-air cinema time.
In real.

item.title: First Plates
item.description: learning the wet plate collodion process. The first plates, that somehow look like an image. But sure - they are still far from perfect. Shot now ~ thirty plates, glass and tintypes, to come to the first modest results. More than 30 plates with bugs and holes, scratches and fog. But the new ones are getting better and better. Some issues with expossure, some with the chemicals. But pouring the plates feels very natural now. I am realy surprised. There is still a long way to go and a lot to develop ;)

item.title: wet plate - first steps
item.description: learning the wet plate cpllodion process First pictures, that somehow look like an image. But sure - they are still far from perfect. Shot now ~ 30 plates to come to this point.

item.title: my little darkroom inside my 7m² 'bureau'
item.description: This is a 1.5 m² growing tent converted into a small darkroom in my 7m² office room ;) So far it works pretty well for wet plate. Next days I will pimp it up a bit.

item.title: my little darkroom inside my 7m² 'bureau'
item.description: This is a 1.5 m² growing tent converted into a small darkroom in my 7m² office room ;) So far it works pretty well for wet plate. Next days I will pimp it up a bit. It has a microphone built in where I can set the lights to red, white, on and out via voice control. Also I can set timers via voice. This is controlled via an rasberry pi with rhasspy as voice recognition framework.

item.title: Mobile Darkroom
item.description: # Two days after the first attempts with collodion, I spontaneously had the idea of looking for some accessories at an antique market. We arrived late, only a few dealers were left and most of all the stuff more or less had been boring. One stand stood out. There were old lockers from old eastern german NVA stocks, some old metal cabinets, a few suitcases and a lightweight, portable wooden box with metal fittings.

item.title: Sunflower Dawn
item.description: a sunflower lowers its head - below the fields of Hambach castle - autumn 2021

item.title: about
item.description: just a small ongoing project to line up shards between infinite and meaningless …. nothing more This website was actually conceived to accompany a positive path in the 2020 pandemic. Very quickly, my ideas were shattered by reality. I then quickly threw over the concept of the website. While sorting, I stumbled across the photo of the sunflower at Hambach Castle. Of course, you can't see the reference in the photo.

item.title: This one is different
item.description:
This time is different.
No total silence - no birds
No save enough for jogging on mainstreet.
Too much hatred and bias.
The world needs a breather and a psychiatrist

item.title: Audit
item.description:
If I ever had to make a decision about who to bring on board and whom not
In the event of a war or other disaster
I think I've made a choice these weeks.

item.title: Jogging on an empty main street
lockdown/unlock
item.description:
Two possibilities.
Both sides of the same coin.
Choose wisely.
I choose the third option - as usual
